title: Chemist I
full_description: Company InformationFounded in 1977, Diversified Laboratories, A FoodChain ID Company, has over 40 years of experience protecting our customers by analyzing and detecting pesticides, PCBs, chlorinated dioxins, chlorinated hydrocarbons, and other chemical contaminants in food and animal feed products. Pesticides are highly persistent in the environment and are readily stored and concentrated in poultry and livestock tissues and therefore represent a concern for human health. The dangerous nature of these industrial chemicals requires constant vigilance at all levels, from the corporate arena to federal, state, and local governments. EPA has established tolerances for these chemicals and the FDA and USDA have the responsibility to enforce them, but our customers bear the burden of compliance to ensure a safe product. The potential economic consequences of contamination, if left undetected, can readily exceed $1 million. Diversified Laboratories makes it as easy and convenient for our customers to ensure safe products for themselves and their customers with quick, accurate, and confidential testing. Our approach has helped preserve a perfect record of no FDA/USDA involvement for over 40 years.Summary At Diversified Laboratories, A FoodChain ID Company we are committed to consistently delivering the highest levels of operation and service excellence in our industry. Our Chantilly, Virginia location is currently seeking a Chemist I to assist with research, plans, and verifies methodologies for stakeholders. The Chemist I is also responsible for performing chemical and physical testing on raw materials, work-in-process, and finished product samples to ensure the quality and safety of consumers. This position requires the ability to act quickly, remain flexible, and manage multiple priorities.Role and ResponsibilitiesWorks with team members to maximize productivity and efficiencyOperates and maintains existing lab equipment and evaluates/implements new lab equipment.Perform diverse analytical and instrument testing utilizing official or approved methodologies appropriate for routine and non-routine samplesDevelop schedules and methods to accomplish assignments ensuring work is completed in a timely and efficient mannerQualificationsBachelor's degree in Chemistry or related field and equivalent combination of education and experience.Experience using GC and/or HPLC instrumentation preferred Efficient with chemical preparation of standards, method development, and handling quality control proceduresExcellent problem-solving skills and the ability to take initiativeRelated experience working in a laboratory preferredExemplary teamwork skills are essential, with little direct supervision.Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality standardsAdditional DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.
